>>34083751
I Ching reading

"What should they choose?"

Opression (47) -> Preponderance of the Small (62)

Line three is most pertinent:

A man permits himself to be oppressed by stone,
And leans on thorns and thistles.
He enters the house and does not see his wife.
Misfortune.

This shows a man who is restless and indecisive in times of adversity. At first he wants to push ahead, then he encounters obstructions that, it is true, mean oppression only when recklessly dealt with. He butts his head against a wall and in consequence feels himself oppressed by the wall. Then he leans on things that have in themselves no stability and that are merely a hazard for him who leans on them. Thereupon he turns back irresolutely and retires into his house, only to find, as a fresh disappointment, that his wife is not there. Kongfu (Confucius) says about this line:

If a man permits himself to be oppressed by something that ought not to oppress him, his name will certainly be disgraced. If he leans on things upon which one cannot lean, his life will certainly be endangered. For him who is in disgrace and danger, the hour of death draws near; how can he then still see his wife?

Should be pretty clear to you.

"What does anon need to know about this situation?"

The Traveller (56) -> The Gentle / Penetrating (57)

The important changing line is line 4:

The wanderer rests in a shelter.
He obtains his property and an axe.
My heart is not glad.

This describes a wanderer who knows how to limit his desires outwardly, though he is inwardly strong and aspiring. Therefore he finds at least a place of shelter in which he can stay. He also succeeds in acquiring property, but even with this he is not secure. He must be always on guard, ready to defend himself with arms. Hence he is not at ease. He is persistently conscious of being a stranger in a strange land.

Whatever this situation is, it's not your final destination, more a stop on the way. I guess there's not strong foundations here and your something of an outsider. You can hold your own but don't get too comfortable or drop your guard completely. It's not saying this is a bad thing just that it's not your end game.

>However, Freemasonry soon was to develop more esoteric dimensions, especially in France. Andrew Michael Ramsay (1686–1743), a Scotsman, was a member of the Philadelphian Society of Jane Leade and Francis Lee, a theosophic circle in London, and subsequently he went to live in France.
Ramsay, who had been initiated into Masonry years before, rose in the French Masonic hierarchy, and in 1737 he gave a famous lecture. In this oration, Ramsay called for a massive project of universal illumination, a joining together of the arts and sciences. He echoes earlier Rosicrucian aims, but there is a more rationalist quality to his work, and it is arguably the case that he served as predecessor for the later French philosophes and their Encyclopédie. But he also linked Freemasonry to the Knights Templar, to aristocracy, and to a kind of mystical chivalry that was very attractive, particularly to the upper class. Many para-Masonic orders thus were generated.
From Magic and Mysticism by Arthur Versluis, i did not know of this connection between Freemasonry and Christian theosophy but it's very interesting how Ramsay is through this also indirectly linked to the Strict Observance Templar group which was taken over by Willermoz and 'rebooted' as the Rectified Scottish Rite

On the basis of my limited experience I can say the Law of Assumption is the core of magic. Structured magic training helps to concentrate our development on some aspects and then we switch to others. Non LoA practices helps technical/scientific minds like mine too.
I practice LoA and LoA related techniques (not Murphy or Goddard), IIH, Kriya Yoga and NeiGong (internal martial arts). They are complementary and you can progress faster combining and mixing methods. Different takes of the same thing, split in different roads for different purposes by different ethnic groups. The core is the same, but each use different names. Some traditions are secret and incomplete like NeiGong lineages, but they can be reconstructed using the other traditions.
A lot of NeiGong that is public is very slow, but mixing with some other practice it becomes faster.
HGA is your subconscious or superconscious.
I have a book on practical Kriya Yoga who explicitly confirms that.
Anyway read practical texts and practice. Some things are natural and others are very difficult. Every person is different.
I am not using grimoires or witchcraft. I want to able to do things on my own without pleading for help to some entity. No one here is an accomplished magicians or we wouldn't be here and in other communities. I don't blindly follow namefags. I evaluate every suggestion but I decide myself.
Keep an open mind and follow your instincts.

>>34081627
Tantraloka 4:62:
>The purpose of self initiation is to mobilize the essense of the mantra which is being practiced. Mobilization of the essence of the mantra results in activation of self knowledge. It has been observed that if one is unable to get a teacher capable of activating the mantra, by praying to Candika Devi (Raktadevi) regularly, one becomes an Acarya within a month, a Sadhaka in a fortnight. A Putraka in a week, and within four days less by quarter of a day, Samayi.
In this process of initiation, Raktadevi is supposed to perform the ceremony Herself as the provision of the Shastras. This method is to be adopted in case of unavailibility of a Guru.
Abhinavagupta comments that you can brute force your way in by constructing your own mantras in accordance with lineal doctrines. Moreover, there's enough interspersed between Tantraloka and Paratrishikavivirana to do the exoteric form of worship and get a sense of mantra installation.
Tantraloka 16:195 is a self initiation via an ordeal of consciousness.
More interestingly, he appears to invite people to practice these rites without initiation to attempt jivanmukti, with the caveat that they recognize they aren't lineal representatives.

Time is objective, but subjectivity affects reality twofold. Subjectivity affects how you experience things, and certain things, like taller people experiencing time slower than shorter people, or people at a higher altitudes aging technically slightly slower than people at lower alititudes. On the flipside, things like the Double Slit experiment show that subjectivity have a real effect on the environment around the subject in question. I don't know if free will is a lie or not, but I will say I can find determinist arguments compelling at times.

What the actual fuck anon, think for a few moments. Youtube and other social media make a profile of you, and use their algorithm to serve you content based on that profile. It stands to reason people with similar interests will get similar recs. Going a bit further, people who like similar things typically have more in common than people who don't. So the reason you're seeing these people isn't cause they're all bots, it's cause you're getting all of the same people aggregated together. Like I'm not going to act like there aren't bot accounts out there, but it's not the apocalyptic tide that Elon claims.

The NAC Protocol (Updated February, 2023)

Morning

1200mg NAC
Oregano Oil (min. 40mg Carvacrol)
Black Seed Oil (1 teaspoon)

Night

600mg NAC
Oregano Oil (min. 40mg Carvacrol)
Black Seed Oil (1 teaspoon)

Continue daily for a minimum of two months and count out 3 weeks with no die off symptoms prior to moving to the next step.

Maintenance Protocol
__________

Morning

600mg NAC
500mg Slo Niacin (nicotinic acid)
100mg Pterostilbene
250mg Pomegranate Extract (40% EA)
Black Seed Oil (1 teaspoon)

Night

500mg Slo Niacin
100mg Pterostilbene
250mg Pomegranate Extract
Black Seed Oil (1 teaspoon)

After every 3 weeks on the maintenance protocol, take 1 week off. Continue to use black seed oil during the off cycle.

Fungal die off symptoms may include :

>Tiredness, exhaustion, muscle soreness, increased chest or nasal discharge, cold or flu like symptoms, cold sores, headaches, rash, acne, irritability, change in stool frequency, volume or color; increased urination, bloated stomach, cramps, increased gas.

OREGANO DOSING GUIDE

For each morning and night dose you need a minimum of 40mg Carvacrol. Do not buy a product unless it is listed. Most products are steam distilled but you will want to confirm that.

If your chosen oregano oil contains a higher amount of carvacrol (60mg+ per cap) you'll want to start with 1 cap morning, 1 cap night. If each cap contains less than 40mg, take 2 morning 2 night.

POMEGRANATE DOSING GUIDE

You want a minimum of 100mg Ellagic acid for each morning and nightly dose. If you buy a Pomegranate extract that has 40% Ellagic Acid, that means a 250mg capsule contains 100mg Ellagic Acid.

posts.name: Space Cowboy
posts.com:
NAC, Oregano Oil and Black Seed Oil have all been proven safe in clinical studies.

NAC has shown to be safe in human trials, even in high doses.

https://pubmed.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/33326056/

Oregano was tested in human clinical trials (both Phase I & II) and found to be safe and non-toxic even at high doses.

See Section 4.1 Safety & Toxicty

https://onlinelibrary.wiley.com/doi/full/10.1002/fsn3.2994

See also a 2 month clinical trial on asthmatics.

https://onlinelibrary.wiley.com/doi/abs/10.1002/ptr.5967

Black Seed Oil and it's primary active Thymoquinone. See:

https://brieflands.com/articles/semj-76453.html

We recommend cold pressed black seed oil, which uses no chemical solvents or heat processing.

https://www.researchgate.net/profile/Vasfiye-Ozyurt/publication/329993761_Cold_press_in_oil_extraction_A_review/links/5c61d58792851c48a9cd3e63/Cold-press-in-oil-extraction-A-review.pdf

Oregano oil at the minimum carvacrol levels of protocol are produced by steam distillation. No additional solvents are required, as it uses vapor condensation to separate the volatile molecules and active compounds.

https://chemdictionary.org/steam-distillation/

Finally, NAC is produced by a reaction between cysteine hydrochloride and acetic anhydride. A LC–UV–MS analysis of NAC shows impurities to be cysteine, cystine and diacteylcystine, which are non-toxic. NAC eventually breaks down to Di-NAC from oxidation, which is also non-toxic.

https://www.sciencedirect.com/science/article/abs/pii/S002196730000741X

posts.name: Space Cowboy
posts.com:
Repost

Pomegranate's antifungal activity against the heavy hitters.

Candida Auris, an extremely dangerous MDR form of CDF, was inhibited with 0.125 to 0.25 µg/mL of Ellagic Acid (POM). This is a miniscule amount. Excellent.

https://www.mdpi.com/2309-608X/7/9/763

Now the big bad Cryptococcus. Let's look at a study on what is normally a fatal outcome. Systemic infection.

>Lip-EA showed 70% survival rate and highly reduced fungal burden in their lung tissues, whereas the mice treated with FLZ (40 mg/kg) had 20% survival rate and greater fungal load in their lungs.

So POM wins big over fluconazole. If you want to survive I wouldn't bet on fluco.

What if you are dealing with a SHTF scenario and need to scale up your POM? Good news.

>The present 90-day subchronic toxicity study was performed in F344 rats at dose levels of 0, 1.25, 2.5 and 5% in powdered basal diet, with actual doses of 9.4, 19.1, 39.1g/kg b.w., respectively, in males, and 10.1, 20.1, 42.3g/kg b.w. in females.

>There were no obvious histopathological changes in any of the groups. The no-observed-effect level (NOEL) was estimated to be 5% (3011mg/kg b.w./day) for males and the no-observed-adverse-effect level (NOAEL) and NOEL in females were estimated to be 5% (3254mg/kg b.w./day) and <1.25% (778mg/kg b.w./day), respectively.

https://www.sciencedirect.com/science/article/pii/S0278691507005303

That is an insanely high dosage with no adverse effects. We already know we can scale Oregano, NAC, and BSO if needed.

Good information to keep in the back pocket.

The objective of the present study was to compare cysteine and N-acetyl-L-cysteine in respect to their transmembrane fluxes and find out which one is a better available precursor for the cells and thus better supports the intracellular glutathione synthesis. The n-3 fatty acids influenced the production of PGE2 and the microbicidal activity of macrophages by increasing the production of NO between the initial and later phases of PCM. How the dietary fatty acids alter eicosanoids and the relationship with macrophage microbicidal activity remains unknown but could be due to an alteration in the levels of the eicosanoid precursor. More studies using LNA should be conducted to elucidate the effect of n-3 and n-6 PUFA on the immune response during experimental murine PCM.

LNA and its derivatives (EPA and DHA) are omega-3 FAs that have been widely studied for their beneficial effects on human health, mainly the brain, eye, cardiovascular system, and general human growth. However, their utilization as antimicrobial agents has not been widely appreciated perhaps because of little understanding on antimicrobial mechanism. Nonetheless, the efficacy of these agents on microbial cell membranes and their antioxidant properties have been shown to inhibit the growth of microorganisms and thereby promote human health and animal health. Hence, omega-3 FAs can be considered as potential alternative or adjunctive therapeutic agents because of their antimicrobial and immunomodulatory properties. Moreover, the escalating levels of resistance may be minimized because they have been reported to have little effect on evolving antimicrobial resistance (Desbois and Smith, 2010), and are also safe for human use.

Omega-3 fatty acids ameliorate symptoms in several animal disease models, such as sepsis or autoimmune hepatitis, and have been tested in clinical trials with positive outcome. Getting detailed knowledge about the particular direct effects of omega-3 fatty acids on the different cells of the immune system will allow future investigators and clinicians to further optimize and implement omega-3 supplementation for the treatment of multiple diseases.

In the present review, we have summarized the main findings regarding the immunomodulatory effects of omega-3 fatty acids on the different cells that conform the immune system (summarized in Table 1). To our knowledge, from all the immune cells investigated to date, none of them has been found to be inert to dietary omega-3 fatty acids. Generally, ALA, DHA, and EPA exert an inhibitory effect on the activation of immune cells from both the innate and the adaptive branch. Interestingly, some specific immune functions are promoted by dietary omega-3 fatty acids in specific immune cell types, i.e., phagocytosis by macrophages and neutrophils or Treg differentiation, suggesting that omega-3 fatty acids do not act as unspecific immune-repressors.

Omega-3 FAs could be a potential antimicrobial drug with little potential for drug resistance [72]. Yangyang Hu,a Lin Feng,a,b,c Weidan Jiang,a,b,d Pei Wu,a,b,d Yang Liu,a,b,e Shengyao Kuang,f Ling Tang,f and Xiaoqiu Zhoua,b,c,∗
Author information Article notes Copyright and License information Disclaimer

Abstract
This dissertation was primarily focused on the immune response, inflammatory response and molecular mechanisms in the skin, head kidney and spleen of grown-up grass carp (Ctenopharyngodon idella). Six iso-nitrogen diets differing in lysine concentrations (5.6, 8.5, 11.6, 14.4, 17.5 and 20.7 g/kg) were fed to 540 grass carp (164.85 ± 0.79 g) for 60 d. After that, grass carp were challenged by Aeromonas hydrophila for 6 d. This study revealed that lysine deficiency (1) suppressed the growth performance of the fish and decreased their ability to resist skin lesion morbidity, (2) impaired the immune organ's immune response by decreasing the gene expressions of mucin, liver-expressed antimicrobial peptide (LEAP)-2B, β-defensin-1 and LEAP-2A and the production of antibacterial compounds of grown-up grass carp, and (3) aggravated the inflammatory response of immune organs in the fish by increasing the gene expressions of pro-inflammatory cytokines (interferon γ2 [IFN-γ2], tumor necrosis factor α [TNF-α], interleukin [IL]-15,

Lysine enhances the effect of amphotericin B against Candida albicans in vitro
Liuya Zhao 1, Jingchen Jiang 2, Zhenyu Zhu 2, Zebin Liao 2, Xiangwen Yao 2, Yu Yang 2, Yingying Cao 3, Yuanying Jiang 3
Affiliations expand
PMID: 26711896 DOI: 10.1093/abbs/gmv125
Free article
Abstract
Amphotericin B (AmB) is a polyene antibiotic produced by Streptomyces nodosus and has been used for >50 years in the treatment of acute systemic fungal infections. In the present study, we demonstrated that lysine, an essential amino acid, could enhance the effect of AmB against Candida albicans in vitro, although lysine itself did not exert a fungicidal effect. In addition, the combination of AmB with lysine could provide an enhanced action against Candida parapsilosis and Cryptococcus neoformans compared with AmB alone. Lysine could also enhance the antifungal effect of caspofungin or nystatin. An enhanced effect of the combination of lysine with AmB was observed for the prevention of biofilm and hypha formation. Furthermore, our results demonstrated that lysine-mediated oxidative damage, such as the generation of endogenous reactive oxygen species, may be the mechanism underlying the enhancing effect of lysine on AmB. Our results also showed that CaMCA1 gene plays an important role in increasing the sensitivity of C. albicans cells upon AmB treatment. Using AmB together with lysine may be a promising strategy for the therapy of disseminated candidiasis.

Isoleucine Plays an Important Role for Maintaining Immune Function
Changsong Gu 1 2, Xiangbing Mao 1 2, Daiwen Chen 1 2, Bing Yu 1 2, Qing Yang 3
Affiliations expand
PMID: 30843485 DOI: 10.2174/1389203720666190305163135
Abstract
Branched chain amino acids are the essential nutrients for humans and many animals. As functional amino acids, they play important roles in physiological functions, including immune functions. Isoleucine, as one of the branched chain amino acids, is also critical in physiological functions of the whole body, such as growth, immunity, protein metabolism, fatty acid metabolism and glucose transportation. Isoleucine can improve the immune system, including immune organs, cells and reactive substances. Recent studies have also shown that isoleucine may induce the expression of host defense peptides (i.e., β-defensins) that can regulate host innate and adaptive immunity. In addition, isoleucine administration can restore the effect of some pathogens on the health of humans and animals via increasing the expression of β-defensins. Therefore, the present review will emphatically discuss the effect of isoleucine on immunity while summarizing the relationship between branched chain amino acids and immune functions.

posts.com:
Branching Out: Alterations in Bacterial Physiology and Virulence Due to Branched-Chain Amino Acid Deprivation
Julienne C. Kaisera and David E. Heinrichscorresponding authora
Danielle A. Garsin, Editor
Danielle A. Garsin, University of Texas Health Science Center at Houston;
Author information Copyright and License information Disclaimer
Go to:
ABSTRACT
The branched-chain amino acids (BCAAs [Ile, Leu, and Val]) represent important nutrients in bacterial physiology, with roles that range from supporting protein synthesis to signaling and fine-tuning the adaptation to amino acid starvation. In some pathogenic bacteria, the adaptation to amino acid starvation includes induction of virulence gene expression: thus, BCAAs support not only proliferation during infection, but also the evasion of host defenses. A body of research has accumulated over the years to describe the multifaceted physiological roles of BCAAs and the mechanisms bacteria use to maintain their intracellular levels. More recent studies have focused on understanding how fluctuations in their intracellular levels impact global regulatory pathways that coordinate the adaptation to nutrient limitation, especially in pathogenic bacteria. In this minireview, we discuss how these studies have refined the individual roles of BCAAs, shed light on how BCAA auxotrophy might promote higher sensitivity to exogenous BCAA levels, and revealed pathogen-specific responses to BCAA deprivation. These advancements improve our understanding of how bacteria meet their nutritional requirements for growth while simultaneously remaining responsive to changes in environmental nutrient availability to promote their survival in a range of environments.

The NAC Protocol (Updated February, 2023)

Morning

1200mg NAC
Oregano Oil (min. 40mg Carvacrol)
Black Seed Oil (1 teaspoon)

Night

600mg NAC
Oregano Oil (min. 40mg Carvacrol)
Black Seed Oil (1 teaspoon)

Continue daily for a minimum of two months and count out 3 weeks with no die off symptoms prior to moving to the next step.

Maintenance Protocol
__________

Morning

600mg NAC
500mg Slo Niacin (nicotinic acid)
100mg Pterostilbene
250mg Pomegranate Extract (40% EA)
Black Seed Oil (1 teaspoon)

Night

500mg Slo Niacin
100mg Pterostilbene
250mg Pomegranate Extract
Black Seed Oil (1 teaspoon)

After every 3 weeks on the maintenance protocol, take 1 week off. Continue to use black seed oil during the off cycle.

Fungal die off symptoms may include :

>Tiredness, exhaustion, muscle soreness, increased chest or nasal discharge, cold or flu like symptoms, cold sores, headaches, rash, acne, irritability, change in stool frequency, volume or color; increased urination, bloated stomach, cramps, increased gas.

OREGANO DOSING GUIDE

For each morning and night dose you need a minimum of 40mg Carvacrol. Do not buy a product unless it is listed. Most products are steam distilled but you will want to confirm that.

If your chosen oregano oil contains a higher amount of carvacrol (60mg+ per cap) you'll want to start with 1 cap morning, 1 cap night. If each cap contains less than 40mg, take 2 morning 2 night.

POMEGRANATE DOSING GUIDE

You want a minimum of 100mg Ellagic acid for each morning and nightly dose. If you buy a Pomegranate extract that has 40% Ellagic Acid, that means a 250mg capsule contains 100mg Ellagic Acid.

NAC, Oregano Oil and Black Seed Oil have all been proven safe in clinical studies.

NAC has shown to be safe in human trials, even in high doses.

https://pubmed.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/33326056/

Oregano was tested in human clinical trials (both Phase I & II) and found to be safe and non-toxic even at high doses.

See Section 4.1 Safety & Toxicty

https://onlinelibrary.wiley.com/doi/full/10.1002/fsn3.2994

See also a 2 month clinical trial on asthmatics.

https://onlinelibrary.wiley.com/doi/abs/10.1002/ptr.5967

Black Seed Oil and it's primary active Thymoquinone. See:

https://brieflands.com/articles/semj-76453.html

We recommend cold pressed black seed oil, which uses no chemical solvents or heat processing.

https://www.researchgate.net/profile/Vasfiye-Ozyurt/publication/329993761_Cold_press_in_oil_extraction_A_review/links/5c61d58792851c48a9cd3e63/Cold-press-in-oil-extraction-A-review.pdf

Oregano oil at the minimum carvacrol levels of protocol are produced by steam distillation. No additional solvents are required, as it uses vapor condensation to separate the volatile molecules and active compounds.

https://chemdictionary.org/steam-distillation/

Finally, NAC is produced by a reaction between cysteine hydrochloride and acetic anhydride. A LC–UV–MS analysis of NAC shows impurities to be cysteine, cystine and diacteylcystine, which are non-toxic. NAC eventually breaks down to Di-NAC from oxidation, which is also non-toxic.

https://www.sciencedirect.com/science/article/abs/pii/S002196730000741X

The objective of the present study was to compare cysteine and N-acetyl-L-cysteine in respect to their transmembrane fluxes and find out which one is a better available precursor for the cells and thus better supports the intracellular glutathione synthesis. Cysteine can directly participate in glutathione synthesis, whereas N-acetyl-L-cysteine must be first deacetylated before its incorporation to glutathione. >>34077130
>Did I get this right?

Yeeeeees'ish.
Let me nitpick you a little.

>Different gods, angels, spirits, demons, etc. all exist because of a collective belief that they do.

Spiritual entities don't *need* us to believe in them after they've been conceived. Acknowledgment, names, praise, anima, "belief", does make them feel better though and gives them cultural presence/persistence. It's kind of like the monomyth or the Hundreth monkey effect: once at least 100 people know something it becomes substantiative enough to self-perpetuate in a manner.

>So if you genuinely believe in a particular angel or demon or pagan god, it will manifest itself when you go to the astral realm, in a way that is particular to you,

No. This is slightly wrong for three reasons:
1. A single person can point something out and get the ball rolling, but identity is formed through collective consensus and the grander community of thought.
2. Ideas aren't without intention: they have their own motives, aspirations, and goals. Enough if it's only to perpetuate themselves.
3. "Memes are the DNA of the soul" a concept that's mature can take on it's own life and in turn begin influencing, changing, and shaping, an individual for their own selfish means.

Is the orphan that steals bread to live, and grows into a thieving adult really that much worse than a child of good parents, raised in good conditions, who has never had a need to do wrong?

Perhaps I cannot sense God's justice, and His fairness in doling out judgment. But I can see that man and all of his religion's are imperfect, flawed, and honestly, condemnable.

Each religion has central tenets that must be followed to a T, which can vary widely depending on the faith. These tenets, at least in the past, often carried capital punishments for disobedience to it. Especially the Abrahamic ones. Of Christians, the Catholic must pray his Rosary, the Protestant must be Sola Scriptura, the Orthodox must have his deathbed confessions. I don't know as much of the Muslims, but I know that they tend towards the extreme in these regards as well.

So in my doubt and lack of faith, I feel only the angst in that perhaps my experiences searching for "enlightenment" may have led me to the correct view of all existence.

That suffering, in it's most inescapable, horrific forms is inevitable. As are the greatest pleasures, I suppose, but I cannot sit well with any concept of "balance", if one half of all things is to be rotten and the other half is to be good. Existence itself must tend towards good. The light must illuminate darkness.

Should I consider anything else, I begin to feel as I lost grasp on reality. I feel as if I am in a boat, slowly sinking and I can only watch as the water envelops me, threatening to swallow me whole. This knowledge, should it be true, is too much for one man to bear. Especially if I were to believe that there is no true objective nature to existence. To experience things itself, is not a worthy objective. To return to a source after bearing incomprehensible suffering AND pleasure for an infinite amount of time is not good. I refuse to believe it because it terrifies me to the core.

It keeps me up at night and chills me to the bone. It robs me of a good and simple life, and it leaves me with endless ponderings that necessarily lead to nothing good. How can I ever be apart of society after this? And how can I ever fall back into the illusions of organized religion, except as a petty means to cope?

I hope some other anons know what I'm talking of, because I fear it is more common an experience than we can realize. True ego death. Not at all an enlightenment, it would seem.

They ignited the burn on purpose, and DESU I think it was the right choice. Vinyl chloride is a deadly poison and had they let it just settle into the ground it would have rendered the area uninhabitable. With the burn they turned it into hydrogen chloride (HCl), CO2, and phosgene (COCl2). CO2 is relatively harmless outside of greenhouse effects. HCl will leave the atmosphere in the form of acid rain, which is bad but not as bad as vinyl chloride. Phosgene is pretty awful stuff, and I think the rationale was that over time it would spread all over and become so low in concentration it would have no effect.

It was truly a lose-lose situation.

You can't. The point of such deals is that Satan. or any other demon. doesn't have the authority or power to actually carry them out (except if the requested deal is for the demon to e.g. harm someone) and so it's a fools deal that pointlessly damages your own soul. It's not even really a deal as your soul belongs to God, you don't have the ability to sell it. In short don't.
>I tried everything, tried to become god's agent, vowed to help humanity, etc.
You're seeking works with the intention of getting something, in other words you're trying to be God's mercenary. But God wants sons, not mercenaries. The aim of the Christian life is to learn how to be God's child, and therefore to continue following His word even when you are greatly suffering, out of love for Him rather than the idea that it'll lead to an end of suffering.
>If god and the angels want to keep fucking me over, so be it.
They aren't doing anything more than leaving you with the consequences of this or that on Earth. They are merely withdrawing some protection, and as they have done so it's been shown that your faith was previously a mercenary one. You should use this opportunity to redouble in faith, not to pull back from it.
>from doing the LBRP daily
Not a traditional practice. When praying pray more.. traditional things. Our Father, prayer to St. Michael, Hail Mary. etc.
>Even if I can't literally sell my soul, I will become an agent of chaos and sin. Fuck you god, buddhas, and saints. Eat shit
You're choosing the exact same path the Devil chose.

You need to understand that the point isn't to love God because He is some kind of slot machine. It's to love God for His goodness, for His deigning to be present with us, for His majesty and beauty. This is hard and I don't claim to do so either. But that is the point- that it's hard: "Enter ye in at the narrow gate: for wide is the gate, and broad is the way that leadeth to destruction, and many there are who go in thereat."

I had a dream back in september, not going to go into it, took place this last full moon I became aware at the last second (disturbingly). Death symbols everywhere. My dream came true however, whatever had left me has returned. Or it came back from another world.

Fuck it, I'll briefly describe the dream. Dead of winter, full moon, cold blue light on the snow. I'm talking to my mother, we decide on something and then both start running. Except she runs one way, and I run the other. I jump over a bank and instead of landing where it actually is, I land on the beach of a lake (known to me). Gray ice water. I fly up and look down upon the lake, then fall back first. I hit the water and begin to sink to the depths. The light from the moon fades and disappears. I sink into the abyss. Then I fall out the bottom into the sky. Open sky and sun above. I'm falling through all this abstract machinery, morphing, changing. There were other dreams but that was about it.

It finally hit me that it matched the structure of several stories I wrote like 15 years ago. The water is a death symbol, not transformation. Can't go there without dying. Either the body sleeps for a while in there and is then washed back up on shore, or it falls through into the sky. Next comes a journey to the moon. I look down on the Earth. I found a cube up there, it was decaying. Finally an underground journey through a cave system. I kept dreaming of water, going into the water, being compelled. This last year or so I have had zero will, void within, body and mind can't be puppeted, empty vessel, hollow. So I figured it was the end, fo someone.

No one died though, symbolically or otherwise, that I know of.

posts.name: Anonymous
posts.com:
I think the main difference is:

There are those who only think in terms of the self/ego etc and no real belief in say "the other world" or "force" "subconscious communication" "creative flow" etc - although this isn't the wrong way either because I dislike that perspective of "we're better than those sheep who haven't opened/unlocked the best viewpoint etc" - but it's more likely they would still believe that dreams are just chaotic random nonsense and just plain "weird" when really it's probably & personally to me the ideal key to what the other side is (as well as creativity, and the correct substances etc)..

but i know it's ridiculous to make this distinction and generalise / criticise, but i just feel like in general terms people are scared of the viewpoint because religion has made it this crazy cultlike thing you shouldn't believe in even though it's a personal creative thing within us all... i mean you could have a faith entirely of Simpsons references if you really wanted to...

and then there are those who can tap into this energy that exists, the guidance system, a higher self that communicates with oneself.. problem is i don't know what it means or where it takes us at times, but it feels great and makes me feel at one with myself or at least, hold on to the rocks that keep us stable at times.. i suppose the mystery and sense of awe is what keeps us captivated at times..

ironically i suppose it's this longing for "sharing" these viewpoints that made me really in tune with my own personal spiritual self, so through solitude i came across my own negotiation techniques with the otherside so to speak, which would probably explain why solitude is always promoted in these trains of thought...

i dunno if i'm like a literal believer in gods and demons though i definitely used to be, i think the entities are all like manifestations of the personal universe within us all. i used to worship a god of some description that was rooted in finnish paganism (my roots) but maybe that was isolation doing a number on me. although through the messages of dreams i find myself buying things in the name of the "other side" - no matter how silly (usually food items and other things). for what purpose? just because it feels like the correct thing to do. and maybe i'm just hungry.

what i've noticed is that the higher gods can communicate through our "dance/rhythm/imagination/spirit/intuition" but the lower demons tend to emanate through unwanted hallucinations. it explains why schizophrenics tend to have these negative experiences. i luckily am able to experience the former to a high regard but the background noise for the latter can be a bit silly (thanks to some mild weed induced psychosis, its very minor/quiet/incomprehensible though and i can never take it seriously, like an OCD thing and doesn't get in the way of my regular thought pattern. no visual hallucinations either luckily. strangely i do hear voices of other people in bed after a night out/drugs, but it's mostly just silliness i can ignore or play with, even though the content is neutral/negative, but i feel protected by my own spirit and imagination luckily), as a cat once spoke to me in a dream "Why did you open both doors?!"

anyway no, im from the uk :)

Demons, interdimensional entities that exert a negative psychic and occasionally physical influence over mankind, are real. I'm not religious. I'm a secular leftist. But it does seem clear to me that there are conscious, sentient, negative entities living in the cracks of our mathematical interdimensional reality.

Now what are they? What do they want? And how do they operate?

The first question isn't so much important as the 2nd two.

They want you to feel pain. They are psychically attuned to despise the psychic energy of positivity.

Why?

Because our reactions to positivity and positive social stimuli are rooted in evolutionary science? Because positive vibes make us happy because being around happy people helped us survive in the past?
Possibly.
Or perhaps they are simply the anti-matter to our matter.
One can only speculate.

I do know how they operate, however.
They manipulate you through fear. Because fear leads to hatred. And hatred destroys the positive psychic vibes they detest.
They whisper in your ear. They tell you to be fearful of others. Fearful of foreigners. They tell you to believe conspiracies. They tell you to be fearful of those different from you. They make you suspicious. Distrustful. They attempt to gain your trust by telling you what you want to hear. They'll tell you you're a god. Or you're special. Or you're "chosen". And as such, you'll start believing them. And then they'll start making you fearful of others. Soon you'll be isolated and unwilling / unable to function in society. I suspect many on this board are suffering from these demons.

Learn to be vigilant without becoming dominated by your vigilance or else you will fall

Demons are energetic beings. They desire to live, just as all living things do. Because they are negative beings, they perpetuate through negativity. Having no corporeality of their own they require thinking or feeling hosts to occupy and live through. Without those they don't die, but they lie dormant as potential.

You can imagine certain emotions as beings with their own will and intentions that arise in your mind or your body. In the past overly emotional people, hysterical people, would have been seen as possessed, and it's easy to see why even if you are an atheist. An emotional person is not self-aware but driven by the emotion, they are the emotion.

Abstract ideas and concepts can be seen this way too. Think of capitalism or the economy, for instance. These are self-perpetuating concepts that feed on people and exist apart from them, but that leech energy from them.

>>34073924
it's to develop an awareness. you can acknowledge your emotions, you can be aware of them, but the goal of mindfulness is to avoid getting caught up in them, or lured away by them.
take this passage from the Bible
>When I was a child, I spoke as a child, I understood as a child, I thought as a child: but when I became a man, I put away childish things. — 1 Corinthians 13:11
A child does not think "I'm acting so childish right now" when they're doing their kid stuff like playing make believe, throwing temper tantrums, etc. it's only when they grow older that they can look back in hindsight at how they acted, since they now have a distance from their childhood counterpart.
now, think of it in terms of mindfulness meditations.
when you're feeling extremely happy, angry, whatever, you're typically not thinking "I'm so happy" "I'm so angry" etc.
no, you're in the throes of whatever emotion you're experiencing.
with meditation, you are becoming the awareness of those emotions. So, you can still be aware of the feeling of happiness, anger, etc. but not getting swooped up.

basically, think of it as treating the present moment in terms of hindsight. you want to strengthen the absolute highest vibration, best parts of yourself.
the new age satanic bullshit of "let it go completely, bro, just give in" is stupid as fuck. yes, you should surrender to the world and to God, meaning you should not hold a tight grip on your life and try to control everything....but at the same time, you should not. absolutely should never. completely rid yourself of the "ego" - that's a new age trap.
>The only thing about a man that is a man . . . is his mind. Everything else you can find in a pig or a horse
There is a reason you have conscious awareness, and awareness of the self. new age hippies want you to turn yourself into a pig or a horse. just "going with the flow" is how things like genocide and tyrannical regimes happen

>>34077384
https://youtu.be/N0fTg23psfw
You can start with this, except do it standing.
Beginners should start with standing practice and a lot of stretching as foundation.
One of the benefits is you can tune into Earth's magnetic field at some point to more easily sink the Qi, help clear some channels and strengthen the physical body some, all good stuff.
Start at wu-chi(Google), knees slightly bent, back straight, neck straight, tailbone tucked slightly inward. Rest the tip of your tongue just behind the front teeth and gently stick it up, all the way back to the throat. Tongue acts as a breaker switch, if things get rough or you wish to conclude the session, you can just "unplug" it and open your eyes.
Close your eyes, sink the breath and simply relax your muscles and let your bones take the weight without breaking form, like you're hagind from a string at the swirl on your head.
The mind is centered behind the navel and between the kidneys, the broad area, not just one or the other. Once there just keep it there.
I guess if you want to feel some stuff first, raise your right palm to chest, facing the solar plexus at around four inch distance, do the same with the left hand towards the navel and relax some. If the breathing and posture are regulated, mind still where it should be, stuff will happen.
Important in all of this is not to do it with conscious intent, sink your mind with the breath and relax.
The point between your kidneys is the Gate of Life, where the "juice" flows endlessly down the Sacral bone to the perineum. That is the most basic negative energy of the body and the foundation of spiritual practice in every tradition.
Standing practice, zhan zhuang and even horse stance are quite effective for beginners and only surpassed by Half and Full Lotus.

Should you gain any insight from this information, please seek a teacher to learn from. Later on, stuff gets quite complex and often times dangerous if one lacks guidance.

There are many types of meditation for many different ideas, but the meditation practices that magical and esoteric practitioners utilize are derived in part from Tibetan (and more broadly Buddhist) awareness meditation. This type of meditation is not about overcoming emotion or "accepting" things, but about being aware of your emotion, surroundings, and reality. Mastering this awareness allows one into deeper states of understanding about the nature of all things.

posts.name: Anonymous
posts.com:
>>34084290
You say it's not about accepting things, and maybe you have some understanding attached to that word that makes that statement true for you, but from my perspective it is fine to say that the practice is related to acceptance. In the video you posted notice at the end when he says 'thought okay, no thought okay; emotion okay, no emotion okay; key is awareness, focus is awareness, not the object'. In other words, whatever is, is, and you don't struggle with it, don't chase it blindly. Also note that there is a therapy called ACT, Acceptance and Commitment Therapy, which is basically a Westernised and medicalised version of mindfulness. The key word they led with is acceptance.

For me, to say you 'accept' something, is to simply affirm that what is, is, that I am. It is to root the self in awareness, and not in thoughts or emotions or external events or the body. Your reality then becomes singular, because good and bad, happy and sad, this thought and that thought are both processed through the layer of 'it is'. Dual concepts are processed through a singular awareness, and so you negate the bouncing back and forth between polarities such as right/wrong, happy/sad, do/don't etc.

If you were to interpret acceptance as meaning believing, I can understand objections. If you have a thought suddenly that says "you are a worthless person", to accept that thought does not mean you affirm that its content is true or valid or reasonable. You do not enter into the world of the thought. You accept it as a thought, and nothing more or less. It is. You are aware it is a thought. You can then evaluate it for its truth content, or its potential origin.

I will share two stories. Both can be rationally explained, they’re aren’t extraordinary, but I felt like that character in Mulholland Drive (at the diner) who sees the hidden madness behind things.

#1 After divorcing my father, my mother and my siblings lived near the end of a cul-de-sac in a small English town. At the time, I was five or six. It was a Sunday night, and for whatever reason I slept in the same bed as my mother. We both woke around three, and rushed to the window. A man, followed by a helicopter search light was rushing from the end of our cul-de-sac, accessible by a footpath, and up our street. In a flash, he was surrounded by armed police(?) officers dressed in all black. My mother then dragged me away from the window and I quickly fell back into sleep. To this day, she affirms this happened and remembers only as much detail as I do. This was peculiar because it was so out of place for a sleepy town, and that I recall everything happening in complete silence. I can still recall the black silhouettes surrounding the man, and the search light. But not the man or the sounds.

#2 next.

When I was a kid my mom, my dad, and I were driving home late at night and saw a searchlight beaming down on the woods a quarter mile from our house. We thought we could see people walking between the trees but it was too far away to be sure. My dad was driving and he just raced out of there while my mom and I tried to see where the light was coming from. There was nothing in the news about a search, we never actually saw where the light was coming from, and we never heard anything (if it was a helicopter that low and that close how would we not hear something?).
I live near a big airbase so a lot of “UFO” stuff I just chalk up to aircraft I’m not supposed to know about but a silent invisible search vehicle looking for people in the woods is still something my family talks about from time to time.

It's not a cryptid or spirit story, but I do have one I can give you guys. A brief background though;
In Ocala Florida there is a a legend or myth called the Rainbow Men. It sounds like the San Franciscan treat, but it's just a group of hippies that live out in the national park/ woods/ swamp that are less tree huggers and more a band of rapists, druggies, murderers, maybe cannibals. So more like an LA treat or just an average group of Florida Men.

About two years ago I'm talking with some shooting buddies online and bemoaning the fact that I have nowhere to practice three-gun. One of them gives me some GPS coordinates for a spot hes used in the past when he lived here and I decide I should check it out because why the fuck not?

At this point I had not heard of the legend so I get myself strapped with gear: my AR, a 12 guage, and a revolver because I can't shoot a semi auto handgun for shit. I Load it up along with some water, rations, orientation gear, etc in a backpack and a tac vest; pile in the car and head out to the state park where I strap up and start marching inna woods.

>>34078553
I have myself a nice time and when it's about 6, before it gets dark, I pack up and start heading back covered in sweat and mud and stinking of BO, gunpowder, and blood. It's been a great day and I'm enjoying my hike back now that I'm a little lighter after having spent a good $200 or more in ammo so I'm thinking to myself and not paying too much attention as I walk through a deep ravine because fuck climbing it.

This is when I hear a rustling and immediately snap out of it, shoulder my rifle and insert the last remaining 30rd I've got in it and start scanning my surroundings. Contrary to what you may think Florida doesn't have very many large land predators dangerous to people save the swamp panther which is sadly near extinct, but it's not impossible that one may be stalking me.

I keep walking and I hear something again, scan, nothing. Then I check the ravine top. It's an old yuppie looking couple in white and pink and all manner of vomit pastel and neon mixes crouching down and watching me like it's fucking TES or something and they want a stealth bonus. I just do what comes natural without thinking and wave while saying "Hi there, how y'all doen'? Trails that way." and point at my heading and keep on walking. The man screams "Run RUN!" and they book it in the OPPOSITE direction. I don't think much of it, but when I described the situation to a coworker when she asks what I did for my three day vacation she laughs and says they probably thought I was a rainbowman and so I went home that day and looked up the legend.
I became someone else's inna woods story.

posts.name: Anonymous

>>34079565
>look back to the lights, catch 2 of the three lights making the final rotation around the right side of the craft and then darkness
>can no longer see any indication of craft, a literal second later roommate and I exclaim about the bright orange light that started shining in the distance where we just saw the craft, hundreds of miles away
>roommate and I Wtf the rest of the way home, mention it to eachother every so often
>I still reside in the same area, never see anything like it again
>no longer in contact with that roommate


This whole sequence of events probably lasted a good 20 - 30 seconds.


I'll never forget this strange occurrence, and I've tried to rationalize this a lot throughout the years. Man made commercial craft usually, to my knowledge, have lights on them that indicate which side is which for other air craft to identify them in the air. This thing I saw had none of that.

Only the lights I explained so I know it wasn't any of what you usually see in the sky.

Another thing is that I live in Arizona and this wasn't too far from Luke Air Force Base so it could very well have been expirimental military craft but I really doubt it. Keep your eyes to the skies, brothers. They're out there.

Small handful of personal ones surprisingly:

Before I hit 10 I was walking to my friends house down the neighborhood when I saw a dog walk out of the bushes lining the road maybe 50 or so feet ahead of me. A dalmatian.
It sniffed around for a bit, took a piss on the bushes then fucking stood on its hind legs, took a few steps into the street then turned and looked at me. Not shambling steps, very natural and deliberate ones. I screamed, pissed myself and then ran back home crying. I still have no answers and it haunts me to this day.

When I was in college I was star gazing out by a stretch of road over a swamp in Gainesville and me and the girl I was with saw three green lights moving in formation, slowly spinning like it was a triangle lazily rotating through the air. They then started slowly doing individual figure 8's around each other that quickly sped up before they suddenly shot off in different directions in the night sky.

For a few years back I got night terrors of a tapered cylinder that would stand in the corner of my room but where filled in with tv snow/ static. They made no sound and emitted no light. I only had this experience two or three times though and never again. Never did anything, just stood there. Like a rip in realities fabric or something. Apparently though that's a common one.

That dalmatian still fucks me up.

I used to work security in an industrial park, as the only guard on duty. There were 5-6 corporate offices we woud patrol, with large parking lots and some light forest in between. We would do the shift handoff at midnight in one of these lots, basically BS with the oncoming guard for a while to let them know if anything was going on.

One night an extremely dense fog rolled in, you could only see maybe 20-30 feet in front of you before everything became a wall of white. Shit legit felt like the Silent Hill otherworld.

So I'm fiishing my shift at midnight, talking to the oncoming guard, mainly just cracking jokes in the middle of this giant, empty, foggy parking lot. Suddenly we both stop talking as this white orb of light floats through ourvery limited field of vision. It was shaped like an oval maybe 6 feet x 4 (hard to tellexactly), and passed about ten feet from me, moving from our rear-left to right in front of us, then receding into the fog over the course of 2-3 seconds. It looked like a dim light without a source, like it didn't emanate from anywhere.

>Me and coworker both stare into the fog.
>You see that?
>Yep.
>You're gonna leave me out here with a ghost.
>Yep.
>Get in car and drive carefully home.
>Never talk about it again.

That campus was weird, the cleaners refused to be in one of the bulidings after dark becuase of creepiness, but I never heard any other reports of orbs/lights again, and were out there every night of the year patrolling.

You already have it, if you don't believe me I have two arguments:
1.- Finite Vs. Infinite: Imagine that instead of living for 100 years or something you lived for a minute. So it's all of eternity where nothing happens, then BAM, you are born, for a minute, the minute ends, and then it's all eternity not existing. Well it turns out that against eternity 1 minute and 100 years is no different. If you can imagine that a minute is too short and that it'd have already ended, those 100 years would have already ended too. You're always living within that minute somehow, instead of the eternity before of after where you don't exist. So you are immortal and always living that minute (finite time between eternities.)
If you can't see how 100 years and 1 minute is the same at the scale of eternity, here's the second argument:
Things happen again. In this one, you assume that you came from nothing, that before you were born there was nothing, and after death there was nothing. What's the problem if you came from nothing once, why can´t you come from nothing again? You can extend it to the lifetime of the universe, if it came from nothing, why not again? You're immortal because even if you die and go to nothing you can come from nothing like you did when you were born.
QED

posts.name: Anonymous
posts.com: Currently camping, sort of. Cousin and I went Hunting this weekend, went well, but come Sunday evening I decided to stay at the cabin for another two days due to having extra vacation time from work. Cousin left sundown Sunday. Last night coyotes howled all through the night as they usually do in this area (Colorado, few hours north of boulder), but around 2:30 AM, after several minutes of howling they all suddenly stopped, seemingly at once. I’d woken up to the sound of them, and I’ve never heard them all stop so suddenly, as if just ‘switched’ off. Several minutes of silence followed, which was unusual as usually some light yipping follows of some kind. Eventually, I heard the most piercing, loud, gutteral howl I have ever heard in my life, and for reference, I grew up in woods like this, and regularly been in them for near 26 years, I’ve heard it all, and this was the first noise that ever truly gave me that cold, creeping sense of dread where you freeze, even if for just a second. It sounded like a coyote being torn apart, before sputtering out into a lower tone, and then silence. I sat. Nothing more. I figured maybe it was just that, something dying, and shrugged it off. Until today. I decided to hit the creek and go fishing, and what I saw… both disgusts and haunts me. I can’t even describe what I saw as a ‘carcass’ or a ‘kill’ from a hunt, it looked, sort of, like a coyote, but so utterly torn apart, it’s head detached, bowels hanging out, a limb five feet away, and blood. So much blood. And the stench. Not rot, but… musk, a musk that made me feel like choking. Unnerved, I headed back to the cabin to instead just chill and read. Until the scream came again. at about 5:45 PM, the stench came. Horribly. I went to look for it’s source. Eventually, I was led to my porch. I couldn’t make it out, but it looked like something was hanging out at the woods edge, just squatting, staring at me.

posts.name: Anonymous
posts.com:
>>34083301
not so much a legend or a tale but more a local conspiracy of sorts.

I come from a very rural hamlet, rural enough to not have a proper internet connection outside of cellular data - and even then that's spotty at best. I've since moved but this story stuck with me, I don't think I or anyone else from the town has posted it yet online.

The story goes that in the late 60s during the Vietnam war, there was a "flash draft." A few townsmen had been drafted before, and the townsfolk weren't expecting another draft. Stranger still, the draft mostly targeted teenage boys and even took a few middle-aged women. To this day those taken by the draft are still missing, and the government flatly ignores any attempts from the townsfolk to confront the government about the so called "flash draft."

Where it gets stranger still is a recollection of it I heard from my grandma, who was 16 at the time. My grandma had a brother who was 2 years younger than her and was taken in the draft, and according to her, he didn't leave like normal, as her older brother who was 4 years older than her had also been drafted only to be discharged because he was retarded and couldn't be trusted with a gun. An unmarked, army-green van with darkened windows had showed up and her younger brother simply walked out and got in, like in a trance. She remembers looking around the town and seeing several other of these unmarked vans all parked at various houses in the town, along with seeing this non-descript nuclear family standing on the lawn of a house she knew was abandoned. Posed in a very stereotypical, stock "family photo" pose. No camera in sight.

>memeticists
tl;dr there existed a religion in pre-dynastic Egypt based on the lore of 9 gods, first of which being what we now call Thoth, and the other eight being his retinue consisting of 4 pairs of male and female deities, each having domain over some fundamental aspect of reality.
The creation myth of this religion contains some stuff about reality being made of sequences of repeating integers, which this retinue chanted to create the world. (Thoth himself was self-created in this lore. His retinue somehow brought him into existence at the beginning of this process so he could order and refine them in such a way that they could accomplish this task. Various re-tellings conflict on the exact details of this.)
This religion apparently wasn't dead for all those millennia, it was just sleeping.
This is a bit of a simplified explanation, but hopefully it gets the basic point across.

posts.name: Anonymous
posts.com:
>>34033077
119 is probably the strongest.
>This psalm is one of about a dozen alphabetic acrostic poems in the Bible. Its 176 verses are divided into twenty-two stanzas, one stanza for each letter of the Hebrew alphabet; within each stanza, each of the eight verses begins (in Hebrew) with that letter.[13] The name of God (Yahweh/Jehovah) appears twenty-four times.
>The acrostic form and the use of the Torah words constitute the framework for an elaborate prayer. The grounds for the prayer are established in the first two stanzas (alef and beth): the Torah is held up as a source of blessing and right conduct, and the psalmist pledges to dedicate himself to the law. The prayer proper begins in the third stanza (gimel, v. 17). Like many other psalms, this prayer includes dramatic lament (e.g. verses 81–88), joyous praise (e.g. verses 45–48) and prayers for life, deliverance and vindication (e.g. verses 132–34). What makes Psalm 119 unique is the way that these requests are continually and explicitly grounded in the gift of the Torah and the psalmist's loyalty to it.
https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Psalm_119

>>34035768
It's very simple. When you do the Psalm Magic formula with EVERY Psalm (set a desire, read the Psalm out loud once as an incantation, then read through it again to find the occult meanings), then that's one degree of initiation. Doing it again counts as another degree, and so on. You don't have to do the Psalms in order. Don't forget that Psalm 119 is broken up into multiple Psalms.

Not recommended to rush the process, since the wisdom comes from deciphering the meanings of each Psalm. If you feel like a Psalm's calling you to go over it multiple days, do so.

Source: Ariel Gatoga and Pater Amadeus mention these in their booklets.

>>34015108
>>34015413
>God promised to give back 10x (tithe means ten) whatever's offered to Him
horrendously false. Tithe means tenTH, as in you are to give a tenth of your income (money but also produce itself as most people in history did not have income in money). The tithe was not a generous gift but required in the Mosaic law, it was to sustain the Levites and priesthood and for maintenance of the temple. This was how they stayed alive as they were not given any land inheritance in Canaan, the tithe was God's provision for them.
There is Scripture that says if you give (freely, so not as part of the tithe) to someone who you do not expect to be able to pay you back, God will repay you. But the implication there is not that the "repayment" will be a literal monetary gift or any specific concrete blessing. Rather it is that you aren't simply throwing away resources, God sees what you did as an act of kindness and obedience to His Word and He will not forget.

God owes you nothing and He never will. Any blessing you have received He gave you because of His immeasurable grace.

>>34052695
>to be fair the whole bible is "trust me bro". I'm still undecided whether or not paul was a false prophet tho.
Paul literally says "don't trust me bro".

Romans 3:7 (KJV)
For if the truth of God hath more abounded through my lie unto his glory; why yet am I also judged as a sinner?

Later translations try to cover up for Paul, saying that he was hypothetically speaking for someone else (like the NIV translation for example). However, it's clear that he's talking about himself, because he directly misquotes the Bible multiple times.

Isaiah 28:16
Therefore thus saith the Lord God, Behold, I lay in Zion for a foundation a stone, a tried stone, a precious corner stone, a sure foundation: he that believeth shall not make haste.

Paul twists the quote like so:
Romans 9:33
As it is written, Behold, I lay in Sion a stumblingstone and rock of offence: and whosoever believeth on him shall not be ashamed.

Deuteronomy 30:14
But the word is very nigh unto thee, in thy mouth, and in thy heart, that thou mayest do it.

And again Paul changes the meaning to suit his teachings.
Romans 10:8
But what saith it? The word is nigh thee, even in thy mouth, and in thy heart: that is, the word of faith, which we preach;

The former clearly says "that thou mayest do it", as in, to uphold the law through your actions, in direct opposition to Paul's "you just need faith bro".

In other words, Paul misleads "Christians" like >>34046788 that thought that what Jesus said to do was too hard.

Anons; have you memorized any Psalms yet? I started with no. 23. It is probably the most famous and it's short and easy to memorize.

You can use the trick that actors use which is to read it multiple times so you are familiar; then write down only the first letter of each word in each line.

Once you have something that looks like this;
TLIMS;ISNW
HMELDIGP;HLMBSW
HRMS;HGMISPFHNS
YTIWTTVOFSOD,IWFNE,FTAWM;TRATS,TCM
TPATBMITPOME;THAMHWO;MCRO
SGAMSFMATDOML;AISDITHOTLFE

You should then be able to look at this and recite it without reading the words. Finally, you just keep repeating it until it's part of your memory.

>>34071248
>People only want what's easy without wanting to be better, and will disregard parts of spiritual texts that do not satisfy them. I see this in every form of New Age 'pick what I want, from whatever I want' systems. People see the word 'magic' and assume that it doesn't require them to cut sin from their lives.

I find it really interesting that in Judaism, this process of cutting sin is a logical one in addition to a matter of faith. A lot of weight is given in the process of derivation of the laws through logic, it's a mathematical approach to belief. All that said, I struggle to rectify years of biology, psychology, and ethics which in many ways come to similar conclusions about the nature of evil/sin (selfish gratification) and good/virtue (control of base impulses). Now that I am interested in restoring my faith, I find it difficult to not hear years of study of the sciences overshadow religious texts with the scientific reasoning. I am not saying that it is wrong to learn science - just that it makes this so much harder. We know that much of this wisdom was boiled down to simple terms and allegory to be interpreted for the masses in a communal setting through years of study. This is an aside but it's one reason why it makes me so angry that there are people who interpret the texts literally. These texts are supposed to be mulled over and meditated on over a lifetime.

I feel that the only way to overcome this struggle is to go even deeper in the religious texts and attempt to achieve wisdom through mysticism. That requires a lot of dedication. Psalm magic isn't a one and done, it's a process. If you're not up for the process you won't reap the benefit.

Still I do feel better reading the psalms. It's alleviating the pain while I'm going through one of the worst episodes of my life.

23 And all the families assembled consisting of about six hundred thousand men, and they went to seek an extensive piece of ground to build the city and the tower, and they sought in the whole earth and they found none like one valley at the east of the land of Shinar, about two days' walk, and they journeyed there and they dwelt there.

24 And they began to make bricks and burn fires to build the city and the tower that they had imagined to complete.

27 And when they were building they built themselves a great city and a very high and strong tower; and on account of its height the mortar and bricks did not reach the builders in their ascent to it, until those who went up had completed a full year, and after that, they reached to the builders and gave them the mortar and the bricks; thus was it done daily.

28 And behold these ascended and others descended the whole day; and if a brick should fall from their hands and get broken, they would all weep over it, and if a man fell and died, none of them would look at him.

31 And they built the tower and the city, and they did this thing daily until many days and years were elapsed.

37 And they ceased building the city and the tower; therefore he called that place Babel, for there the Lord confounded the Language of the whole earth; behold it was at the east of the land of Shinar.

38 And as to the tower which the sons of men built, the earth opened its mouth and swallowed up one third part thereof, and a fire also descended from heaven and burned another third, and the other third is left to this day, and it is of that part which was aloft, and its circumference is three days' walk.

>Cush was the father of Nimrod, who grew to be a mighty warrior on the Earth. He was a mighty hunter before the LORD; that is why it is said, “Like Nimrod, a mighty hunter before the LORD.” The centers of his kingdom were Babylon, Erech, Akkad and Calneh in Shinar (Genesis 10:8-10).

The first kingdom established after the Flood was Kish, and the name “Kish” appears often on clay tablets. The early post-Flood Sumerian king lists (not found in the Bible) say that “kingship descended from heaven to Kish” after the Flood. (The Hebrew name “Cush,” much later, was moved to present-day Ethiopia as migrations took place from Mesopotamia to other places.)

Well, Sun is conjunct with Saturn in 6th house, yet you have Mars opposing the two. The Sun is the self, the core of your being, it wants to radiate, while Saturn is limiting, cold, dark and restrictive. So them being next to each other (Saturn even has the higher degree), means that your self is restricted. Essentially, you have low self esteem, low self-confidence, and maybe a bit pessimistic too. Can mean depression.
Mars opposing these two planets can generally lead to a lot of frustration. Even more so since you already have low self esteem. Mars in Scorpio is a very good placement, but Sun opposite Mars leads to a lot of competitiveness which isn't exactly too bad. However, you also have Mars opposite Saturn, which is bad. Your action oriented self (Mars) wants to push towards one direction, yet is yanked back by the chain attached to its collar by Saturn. So this placement means that you are fucked over by fate or circumstances whenever you want to do something. But since you also have the Sun-Saturn conjunction, I'm gonna go out on a limb and say that you may not even try to do stuff, which against leads to a lot of frustration since you want to do shit. Its quite complex so I'll need your feedback on this.

Mars in Scorpio 12th. A malefic planet in the shittiest house, but the misfortune is relatively alleviated since Mars is in its domicile.
Moon in Virgo. Robotic/autistic.
Moon square against Venus (pleasure and love)
https://astrologyking.com/moon-square-venus/

You are very young, and I recommend you try to attain success in life in any shape or form if you haven't tried to already. Don't doom yourself to NEETdom. I can't stress your Jupiter and Venus placements enough. Have faith in yourself and do your best.

Neck in a natural position, in line with the spine, with the chin tucked in slightly.
Tongue touching the palate lightly, just behind the upper teeth.

It's possible you can achieve something like immortality, but not because of the posture itself. The posture acts as a vehicle for the energy cultivated in meditation to be directed and trained in certain ways.
If you want to try it and experiment, go for it. Just don't get caught up thinking it's the pose itself, the pose is a vehicle for the energy to be developed in certain ways. It's a tool to enhance the meditation and reap particular benefits from it.
That said, why not try it? Worst you can do is keep your body healthy and happy, and best case scenario you become an immortal hermit living in caves meditating and lifting.

>>34045426
Qi Gong and Tai chi are maybe the best examples of this, as well as corruption of understanding.
Alot of people look at these and go 'das bull shite' because charlatans promote the practices for those as a means to an end in of themselves.
But these in particular were meant to develop the energy at an incredibly subtle level, when spiritual illiteracy took over people had no clue how to use these. They reduced it down to a kind of dance.
All of these practices in northern-eastern asia (IE; japan, Korea, China) root back to bodhidharma's transmission. How legitimate that is can be questioned, but it illuminates their purpose from the very beginning. It was always meant to be secondary to the meditation, never the practice in of itself.
If you don't understand meditation, you're not gonna get anything out of these beyond maybe some physical health benefits. It's more apparent with these systems in particular because they were developed with the meditation energy (life force/prana/qi/vriya/piti/whatever) as the main focus as the tool to repair and change the body. It was made for someone who already is cultivating their meditation.
Compared this to normal hindu-buddhist yoga, which cultivates the body to prepare for the meditation and enhance it, instead of the other way around.

Yeah, just sit in full lotus. In our level of development we can talk >>34065792
about “detachment” let the mind and body do it’s thing and all that intellectual talk. but you and I and everyone on the website right here, KNOW, that is not happening. We have zero power to detach. Absolute 0. That’s the problem with all the theory bs. It is not for people with zero samadhi. The theory becomes useful once th foundation is build. NOT before.
So the thing with full lotus practice from our level is it will make you feel discomfort. The discomfort will build untill the point it hurts sooooo much! The ego has a way of overreacting, but yeah it will hurt like hell.
Than sit in that pain, a little longer every time.
The mind will go
>this hurts
>au!
>i quit
>fuck this
>aaaaawwww
>auwww
In the process, you have only 1 thought!
LETS QUIT!
all other bs thoughts of girls, what’s for dinner, what show did I like, and all those other thoughts that just keep filling your brain will be gone.
Just sit in this, and slowly but surely the mind will be trained to recognize 1 thought modus even outside of the pain. That when you start to make progress, and the first actual cultivation benefits can be experienced.
And from that 1 thought the jump can be made to No thought, and that’s when the theory has its use. But too many jump the gun and go directly to detachment and stuff, but they only fooling themselves.
Now what happens and how it works has many more layers, but for us retards , this is the practice untill we can hit that 1 hour every day.

I agree, people who always search for the "right" method or the "right" starting point never stick with one method long enough to see results and they get frustrated.
Directing your focus/your awareness, that's what meditation is, for me it was directing it towards the feeling of my body and the sensations of it, I disliked watching my breath or my thoughts, I focused on the body because that's what felt correct for me. Others say that feeling the body is advanced energy work but for me it was already there since day one, maybe me being a longtime athlete helped by giving me a proprioception sense better than the average human.

After I focused long enough I got to the point that expanding that awareness was easier, then I could focus on my breath or on my thoughts easier, however I decided to expand into other stuff, that stuff could better described as "feelings of my being" which corresponded to some trauma and anxieties I carried within me since childhood, after staying with them long enough I managed to ease the feelings to the point that I became free from them.

So yeah, just find your own path, take advice from everything in life but realize that it's you and only you the one who will take you to where you want to go.

>>34035925
I don't believe you first off, but your bullshit aside, you can improve strength through certain types of meditation. Muscle hypertrophy is the process of strengthening muscle through repeated stress, causing the fibers to tear and heal, becoming stronger and larger. This is what most people do to train strength in the gym. There is another way, however. This is called Neural Adaptation; training your brain and nervous system to utilize muscle more efficiently and effectively.
Whether you define these techniques as meditation is up to you. I want you to stand up and place your arms in front of you. Tighten your core and flex your arms without moving your hands. As hard as you can. Flex until you can feel every muscle in your arm straining. Try to maintain that flex and move to the next step.
While keeping your core tight, reach forward as if you were grabbing onto a ball. Without relaxing your arms, pull them back, as if placing the ball onto a table beside you. Reach forward again and repeat the motion. Keep your arms flexed, your core muscles tight, and breath steadily. Over time your brain will learn more efficient neural pathways to the muscles fibers, allowing you to activate specific muscle groups more effectively. This will not enable you some magical strength, but it will unlock your full potential if done correctly.

posts.name: Anonymous
posts.com:
>>34058660
The position is less important than its purpose. Think of driving. You're in your car, on the road, and though it's supposed to take all your attention, you inevitably begin to do other things: scratch your nose, change the radio, adjust your mirror, talk to your passengers; however, throughout all these things, the skilful driver maintains his driver's posture. This enables him to switchback to his task and maintain focus on what's ahead of him. So too is the posture of meditation.
By aligning the posture of your body to the task at hand (there is a sutra on the favoured poses of the Buddha: walking, standing, sitting, and even lying down) you give yourself another marker of whether you are fully engaged in your purposeful action. If your posture is wandering, so is your mind. This helps one maintain presence and awareness of his body as well as his thoughts.
There is a relationship with this to why some monks practice martial arts. Mastery of one's body is related to mastery of the mind.

Wanna hack your brain and create a state of unwavering focus on a whim? Practice counting. It may take months, but eventually you will overcome pretty much any distractions with ease. Simply lay down or sit up, first focus on your breathing and get into a rhythym that you can maintain without focusing, then start counting 1,2,3- all the way to 1000. At first you will struggle to make it there without your mind wandering. Once you can get to 1000, go to 2000. Then 3, 4, pretty much as high as you want. But once you get to 10,000 I feel like there isnt much more benefit, and thats like over 2 hours of counting. However, this practice will eventually give you godlike focus, and the ability to use that focus at will in any situation.

posts.name: Anonymous
posts.com:
>>34071583
Centralia, WA. Don't live there anymore but grew up there. My friend use to tell me this story about a ghost that haunted Seminary Hill, the Faceless Child. the story goes like this:
In the 1930s, during the middle of the night, a child was kidnapped from his house at the base of the hill. The father of the kid and some neighbors went looking for him. They never found the boy, or the kidnapper. There is a specific trail, that is quite overgrown and secluded. If you walk on this trail alone on certain evenings, you will hear what sounds like a child crying, and you'll see a kid, wearing dirty pajamas, facing away from you. If you call out to the kid or try to approach him, he will turn around to reveal that he has no face, and then he'll kill you. It was never specified if he had no face as in the complete lack of any facial features, or if his face skin was cut off. I never asked.

I don't really know if that qualifies as an urban legend or not, but almost every kid in my neighborhood knew the story. We were all scared shitless to go up into the hill alone.
